definition: to remove the dross/to discard the dregs

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
dregs/draff/pickled in wine/rotten/messy/ruined
grains in distilled liquor

take the cream, discard the dross (political and educational slogan)/keep what is good, discard the rest/You need to be selective when studying./In modernizing the country, don't accept uncritically all foreign ideas.
pinyin: qu3 qi2 jing1 hua2 , qu4 qi2 zao1 po4

definition: to take the best/to absorb the essence
dross/dregs/rubbish/fig. useless residue
lit. to get rid of the weeds and keep the flowers/to separate the wheat from the chaff (idiom)
incorporating diverse things (idiom)/eclectic/all-embracing
the attitude of mechanically borrowing (ideas etc)
marrow/pith/quintessence/essence
abreast of modern developments/to keep up with the times/progressive/timely
to choose the right course and follow it (idiom)
to develop/to make full use of
lit. use others' strengths to make up for one's weak points (idiom from Mencius)/to use this in place of that/what you lose on the swings, you win on the roundabouts
conservative and unable to adapt (idiom)
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
stick-in-the-mud/to stick to old ways/stubbornly conservative
to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
correct any mistakes you made, but maintain your good record if you did not make them (idiom)
pinyin: you3 ze2 gai3 zhi1 , wu2 ze2 jia1 mian3
